1.description: First, create the blade, which will serve as the primary functional element of the knife, providing the sharp edge necessary for cutting tasks. This blade will be positioned at the front of the knife, establishing its dominant shape and defining the overall design, ensuring it is both effective and visually striking.

2.description: Next, add the guard just below the blade, ensuring it is firmly attached to the blade's base where it meets the handle. This component serves a crucial function by protecting the user's hand from slipping onto the blade during use, while also providing additional structural support to the overall assembly.

3.description: Then, add the handle, positioning it securely beneath the guard to create a comfortable grip for the user. This addition is crucial as it allows for better control and maneuverability of the knife while also ensuring a seamless transition from the guard to the blade, enhancing both functionality and aesthetic appeal.

4.description: Finally, add the butt at the end of the handle to provide a finished appearance and improve the overall balance of the knife. This component not only enhances the grip by preventing the hand from slipping off but also reinforces the structural integrity of the handle, ensuring all parts are securely connected for optimal use.
